**The Most High Primordial Heavenly Worthy’s Scripture of the Peacock Radiant King, Spoken by the August Mother of the Jade Emperor, the Queen of Precious Moonlight, Fascicle One**

The Dao speaks: At that time, the Primordial Heavenly Worthy resided in the Heaven of Great Purity, within the Palace of Pure Tenuity in the Land of Floating Radiance, upon the Jeweled Terrace of Jade Nets, emanating nine-colored auspicious lights. Upon a nine-petaled lotus throne, phoenixes sang and simurghs cried, lions and white cranes encircled, while the Thunder Generals of the Four Directions and all the heavens gathered round.

Formerly, on the fifteenth day of the seventh month in the fourth year of the Dragon Han era, the Earth Officials convened to deliberate the methods of the Southern Numinous Nether Calculations and the texts for delivering and rescuing beings. Before the Dao, the assembly expounded: the Great Emperor Ancestor of the Nine Heavens’ Thunder, the Great Emperor of the Nine Heavens’ Life-Generating Spirits, the Four Brahmā Heavenly Kings, the Five Elders and Six Masters with the Four Sages, the True Lords of the Five Sacred Mountains, the Sage Emperors of the Five Marchmounts, the Source Kings of the Four Watercourses, the True Lords of the Five Celestial Granaries, the Eleven Great Luminaries, the Four Pillars of Destiny, the Four Directions’ Winding Deliverances, the Three Realms and Four Offices, the Heavenly Capital and Earthly Prisons, the Water Realms and Yang Ministries, the Twenty-Eight Constellations, the Three Officials and Great Emperors, the Four Ranks of Fire Officials, the Thirty-Two Heavens, the Thirty-Two Emperors, the Three Origins and Three Hundred Sixty-Five Degrees, the City Gods and Village Altars, the Plague Bureaus of the Judiciary, the Five Lakes and Four Seas of the world, the Nine Rivers and Eight Waters, the Twelve River Sources, the Seventy-Two Blessed Lands, the Three Hundred Sixty Famous Mountains, the Eighteen Prisons of the Earthly Offices, the Twenty-Four Prisons of Fengdu, the Thirty-Six Prisons of Lady Qing, the Central Universal Torment, the Eighty-Four Thousand Layers of Ghostly Dungeons, the Great and Lesser Iron Enclosures, the Mountains of Swords and Lakes of Blood, the Gorges of Stone and Avīci Hell, the Ten Kings of the Nether Offices, the Two Hundred Twenty-Six Heavenly Kings, the Seventy Rakṣasī Women, the Twelve Jade Maidens of Incense Attendance, the Twenty-One Dragon Maidens, the Sixty-Four Māyā Women, the One Hundred Thirty Dragon Kings—each and all arrived to assemble. Bowing their heads in reverence, they paid homage, arrayed themselves in order, and stood in ranks to hear the proclamation of the scripture’s meaning.

Suddenly, a Heavenly Mother arrived, riding a peacock. In the Buddhist teachings, she is the Peacock Tathāgata; in the Dao, she is the August Mother of the Jade Emperor, the Queen of Precious Moonlight. She gathered all the great benevolent deities of the Peacock Scripture to come and attend the Dharma-sound, take refuge in the Great Dao, and once more expound the numinous text of the Peacock’s virtue and power. She wished that within the Dao, she might resolve the calamities and hardships of all beings in the world.

At that time, the Peacock Radiant King circled thrice before the Heavenly Worthy and addressed him, saying: “We, the women of the two gates, today are fortunate to hear and behold your compassionate countenance expounding the scripture and Dharma. We beseech your deliverance and salvation. Whatever the ten entanglements, the karmic debts of three lifetimes, chronic illnesses and prolonged misfortunes, demonic specters and malevolent spirits, rebellious stars and constellations, curses and hexes, or all manner of disasters and misfortunes that afflict men and women in the world—if they but sincerely and reverently invite the good Dao, establish the scripture and Dharma in their homes, and perform the rites, all shall be dissolved. If their qi has not yet departed, they shall be spared from crossing over. Once the grievances of their karmic foes are resolved, they shall recover within three days. With pure body and mind, and fresh garments, they shall open the gates and announce to all the spirit shrines, specially summoning the soul and hastening the fate of so-and-so. They shall petition the Thunder Generals, receiving the talismanic commands of the Jade Purity and the august decrees of the Jade Emperor. Earnestly inviting Orthodox Unity Daoists—or three, five, or seven Daoist adepts—whether at home or in a Daoist abbey, they shall request the recitation of scriptures and repentances, light lamps, and perform the ritual circumambulation. Following the liturgical protocols in devotion, none shall fail to receive response. These are the wondrous words of the Heavenly Sovereign; all above shall act accordingly.”

The Heavenly Worthy proclaimed the commands to the Thunder Lords of the Five Directions, the Thunder Kings of the Five Directions, the Cloud and Thunder Envoys of the Eight Directions, the Marshal Generals of the Thunder Department, and the Investigative Envoys of the Nine Heavens. Each issued orders and decrees, bowed their heads in reverence, took refuge, and pledged to obey.

At that time, the Primordial Heavenly Worthy spoke *The Scripture of the Peacock Radiant King, Spoken by the August Mother of the Jade Emperor, the Queen of Precious Moonlight*.

This scripture, in truth, is the marrow of the Great Cavern Scriptures, the transformative work within the scriptures, the application within the scriptures. For this reason, it was widely transmitted to the world below. Those who receive this Dharma-sound bow their heads to listen to the Dao.

Then, the great assembly again addressed the Heavenly Worthy, saying: “From of old, the Primordial Worthy bestowed it upon the August Mother of Precious Moonlight; the August Mother bestowed it upon the August Earth Queen, the Earthly Thearch; the Earthly Thearch bestowed it upon the Three Officials, Four Sages, and Five Elders of the Lofty Perfected; the Five Elders bestowed it upon the Five Masters; the Heavenly Master in turn bestowed it upon the Perfected of Wondrous Conduct, the Great Compassionate and Great Ultimate Universal Assembly, the Azure Net Savior from Suffering and Universal Savior Perfected One, Lord Xu. It was transmitted down through the generations. At one time, the Perfected of Fixed Radiance propagated the wondrous canon, proclaimed the teachings and Dharma, and universally saved all men and women in the world. Should calamities arise, with sincere heart they may burn incense, present memorials and petitions, recite scriptures and perform repentances, submit sincerity and pledge devotion, offer fresh fruits of the season, invite the Dao and welcome the Perfected. With earnest devotion, they shall recite *The Venerable Scripture of the Peacock Great Radiant King*, and reverently pray. In a basin of water, they shall burn the petition for resolving calamities, dispatching it to the Controller of Destinies, sweeping away demonic influences, and receiving the response of blessings. There is none that shall not be spiritually efficacious. To save a single life in the world is to accumulate ten kinds of merit. Together, they shall amass hidden merit and jointly realize the non-action.”

This is the arcane and wondrous liturgy, the secret transmitted once in ten thousand kalpas. If there are men and women in the world who, with sincere intent, proclaim and recite it to save beings, their fortune and longevity shall be boundless.

Thereupon, the Heavenly Worthy spoke a gāthā, saying:

*All voices chant in succession...*

His wondrous form crowns all heavens,
His compassionate radiance illumines the Three Realms.
True Sage, Marvelous Dao, Merciful One,
Teacher upon whom gods and humans rely.
The Great Vehicle bestows the Dharma-word,
The Orthodox Unity points the lost to the Way.
His merit vast as empty space,
Praise of him knows no end.
All voices chant in unison.

Thereupon, the Primordial Heavenly Worthy again addressed the hosts of heaven and earth, the Five Elders and Three Officials, the Four Sages and Ten Thousand Spirits, the Divine Mothers of the Perfected, and the sacred multitudes of Heavenly Mothers. According to the ritual, he transmitted the Five Directions’ Mandates, the True Writs and Divine Mantras, and the names of the Heavenly Kings, each to be recited in joint praise. May they ever grant protection, dispel calamity, and prolong life. May they propagate the Marvelous Dao and expound the numinous texts.

The Dao speaks: This great divine incantation is the wondrous utterance of the Primordial Celestial King, the true revelation of the Jade Emperor Radiant King, the gateway of the Supreme Orthodox Unity, the primordial unity of the Nine Heavens’ inception—mysterious beyond mystery. The Most High Lord of the Dao broadly opens the gate of expedient means; the Dao possesses myriad subtle thresholds. Those who refuse to take refuge inevitably invite peril and misfortune. All fear death and devise countless schemes: some seek heterodox paths, slaughtering living beings; they shake bells to offer sustenance, ransoming souls and bargaining for life. Only when recovery remains incomplete do they finally take refuge—practicing the profound teachings of the scriptures, praising the Dipper and kindling lamps, performing rites of repentance and submitting memorials, reciting with sincere devotion. Within the Peacock Radiant Mother’s sutra reside the ten thousand spirits of the Four Palaces. Through single-minded devotion and cultivation, one may attain its response. Whatever is sought in teaching and transformation shall be granted, and gratitude for blessings received shall be duly offered.

Should any seek to enter this Daoist gate, first let them cultivate impartiality, free from stray thoughts. Arrange their ranks and temper their sharpness, then proceed to the Threefold Purity: first, purify the body from contention; second, purify the speech from contention; third, purify the mind. Further, eliminate the three karmic actions and six sensory roots—thus may one follow the laws of the Three Caverns. For aeons without end, they shall dwell in heaven, ever receiving the Five Fortunes, guarded by the hundred spirits.

When encountering the Three Primes, Five Offerings, four seasons, or eight solar terms—on one’s natal day or birth hour—within a purified chamber, burn incense and sit in silent meditation. Face the long-stemmed candle, bow deeply, and click the teeth. Recite this scripture, and longevity shall be attained. To preserve life and transcend calamity, the Middle Way Incantation for Prolonging Life and Longevity is spoken:

*Recite, and the earth transforms into blossoms.*
*The profound True Unity embodies the scripture, unfolding the texts of the Nine Heavens.*
*Soaring through the hosts of Tai Luo, the golden terrace’s courtier approaches the Sovereign.*
*Beyond suffering’s root, years endure like the sacred tree.*
*The hundred limbs radiate as jade flowers; devoutly I thank the White Prime Lord.*
*The Golden Terrace’s youths inscribe the cloud-mountain gate of true preservation.*
*Virtue and fortune renew with each day; the body’s light illumines the Three Heavens.*
*Purple canopies veil a thousand palaces; the heart takes refuge in the Supreme Honored One.*
*The Five Fortunes ever flow; the adept of the Mysterious is secretly shielded.*
*Demons are driven beyond the Eastern Sea, bearing the Great Radiance of the Void Emperor.*
*No refuge remains in the world—save the gates of hell.*

*How may they attain liberation? The Prime Lord commands the ghosts:*
*Suffer them not to harass living beings. Should they disobey my teaching,*
*Their heads shall shatter into seven fragments, never to know pardon.*
*For ten thousand kalpas, they shall not transcend rebirth. But those who take refuge in the Dao*
*Shall ascend to heaven, exhausting its blessings.*
*After five kalpas of cyclic transformation, good men and good women*
*Together shall receive a thousand springs of fortune.*
*Hasten, hasten, in accordance with the statutes and decrees.*

At that time, the Original Celestial Venerable again addressed the attendant perfected ones on his left and right, saying: "Now I expound the *Venerable Peacock Sutra*, which responds to all without fail. This sutra is exalted and wondrous, universally delivering boundless beings. For you and all others, I expound the causes of eliminating transgressions and extinguishing sins in the hells."

Then the Savior-from-Suffering Celestial Venerable arrived and assembled in great compassion, dissolving all karmic offenses in the hells for sentient beings and rescuing those sunk in suffering. If there are beings who broadly cultivate good causes and make various offerings, they may first deliver their nine generations of ancestors and seven lineages, ascending to heaven, transforming into human rebirth, and only then can they save others from calamities. Liberated from suffering and ascending, they broadly establish merit, opening vast fields of blessings.

Summoning the eight divisions of devas and dragons, the ten generations of earth deities, the Four Brahma Heavenly Kings, the asura celestial kings, King Yama, the officials of Mount Tai—Minister of Destiny, Recorder, Merit Officer, Executioner—the Five Paths Great Spirits, the lords of hell, the underworld officials and scribes, the bureaucrats, clerks, and ghostly soldiers of the Northern Darkness Fengdu, all reverently prostrate, bow their heads, and address the Celestial Venerable, saying: "The karmic retributions endured by sentient beings in the world are all governed by the great demonic obstructions of sin. In the Jambudvīpa realm, those who commit the ten evils and five rebellions, who are unfilial to parents, who break fasts and violate precepts, who slaughter and cook sheep, cattle, horses, the six livestock, flying birds, and running beasts—after death, they all enter the nine dark hells. Day and night they suffer without release. Without broadly cultivating merit, establishing fasts, and making offerings, even if they accumulate merit through torture and confinement in dark prisons, none will ascend to heaven."

Then the Celestial Venerable, day and night contemplating sentient beings, said: "You should heed my words. When any sinful person dies, or when men, women, parents, or kin pass away in the world, you should establish a Daoist altar, perform rituals, scatter flowers, and broadly offer resources. Conduct repentance fasts, and the underworld will measure their deeds. Those with merit will have their transgressions dissolved by blessings; those without merit will endure karmic retribution. Ten thousand taels of gold cannot be taken with you. Only a few scrolls of true scripture, unbound and unrestrained, can be relied upon. Though gold is precious, it cannot secure your future. Those who recite this sutra will all attain liberation. Though this sutra is subtle, it can save the living and the dead."

This scripture, in its origin, was discovered within the Wudang Great Peak.
Li, the superintendent of the Purple Cloud Palace of Supreme Harmony, found a lost scripture of eighty-five scrolls within a cave behind the Cliff of Self-Abandonment. Appended to it was this Daoist Peacock Scripture in three scrolls.
Retrieved from the cave’s depths and returned to the palace, it was revealed to be a convergence of Daoist and Buddhist teachings.
Though some may doubt, I have preserved it within the palace. Unbeknownst, the scripture’s inherent power could not be concealed, and thus it is fitting to transmit it to the world.
Now, copying the ancient text, we distribute it to all directions.
Should Daoist priests recognize its sounds, chant, and recite it, their blessings shall be immeasurable.
Above, it repays the sovereign; below, it aids the three realms.
The nation prospers, the people are at peace, winds are harmonious, and rains are timely.
All people delight in their livelihoods, and everywhere reigns tranquility.

Here ends *The Venerable Scripture of the Holy Mother Peacock Radiant King*.

chunks.original_text: 太上元始天尊说宝月光皇后圣母天尊孔雀明王经 经名：太上元始天尊说宝月光皇后圣母天尊孔雀明王经。 撰人不详，明张国祥校梓。 三卷。 底本出处：《万历续道藏》。 太上元始天尊说宝月光皇后圣母孔雀明王尊经卷上 道言：尔时，元始天尊在大罗天上，清微天宫，浮黎国土，玉罗宝台之上，放九色祥光。 九色莲座，鸾鸣凤唱，狮子白鹤，诸天雷将，四方围绕。 昔於龙汉四年七月十五日，地官较会。 同讲南灵冥算之法，度人拯拔之文。 道前演说时有九天雷祖大帝，九天生神大帝，四梵天王，五老六师四圣，五山真君，五岳圣帝，四渎源王，五斗真君，十一大曜，本命四柱，四方缠度，三界四府，天京地府，水国阳曹，二十八宿，三官大帝，四品火官，三十二天，三十二帝，三元三百六十五度，城隍里社，宪府瘟司，天下五湖四海，九江八水，十二河源，七十二福地，三百六十名山，地府一十八狱冥官，酆都二十四狱，女青三十六狱，中央普掠，八万四千重之鬼狱，大小铁围，刀山血湖，峡石无间，阿鼻地狱，十王冥官，二百二十六天王，七十罗叉女，一十二侍香玉女，二十一龙女，六十四魔耶女，一百三十龙王，各各齐来集会。 稽首朝礼，各依次第，列班听宣经意。 忽有一天母，驾孔雀而来，此乃佛中即孔雀如来，道中乃是宝月光皇后玉皇圣母。 统集孔雀经中诸大善神二俱来参听法音，皈依大道，重演道德孔雀灵文。 愿向道中，能与世问众生解除厄难。 是时，孔雀明王，向前围绕三匝，上白天尊前：妾辈女流，身居两门。 今日幸闻，得睹慈颜演说经法，愿垂救度。 如是世问男女所结十缠，三世冤债，恶病久灾，邪魔魍魉，伏逆星辰，咒誓厌魅，一切灾祸者，但能精虔礼请善道，于家启请经法，一一解散。 气未绝者，应系过世。 冤家解尽，三日即安。 清净身心，衣服新鲜。 开启关白，各处神祠，特与某追魂赶命。 牒告雷将，领承玉清之符命，玉皇之尊言。 虔请正一道士，或三、五、七道众，或在家庭，或於观宇，请诵经忏，然灯行道。 依科修奉，无不应验。 此是天皇之妙言，成上奉行。 宣命五方雷公，五方雷王，八方云雷使者，雷部总兵使者，九天采访使者，各各发号施令，稽首皈依，遵守而行。 尔时，元始天尊说《宝月光皇后圣母天尊孔雀明王经》。 详夫此经，原是大洞经中骨髓，经中之造化，经中之运用。 因此广传下世。 得此法音，稽首道听。 时有大众，再告天尊言：自昔元始授之与宝月光圣母，圣母授之与后土皇地祇，地祇授之与三官四圣五老高真，五老授之与五师，天师复授之与妙行真人、大惠大极普会青罗救苦普救真人许真君，累传下世。 时有定光真人，敷扬妙典，宣行教法，普救世问一切男女。 如或灾难，志心焚香，拜表上章，诵经礼忏，纳款投诚，时新五果，请道迎真，志心谈念《孔雀大明王尊经》，虔诚祝告。 水盆内焚解厄牒，剖付司命，扫荡邪魔，取祝报应，无不灵感。 救济世人一命，皆是十种功德。 共积阴功，同证无为。 此乃玄妙之科，万劫一传之秘。 若有世间男女，志心志意，宣念救度世人，福寿无穷。 於是，天尊而说偈曰： 众念迭声：

**The Most High Primordial Heavenly Worthy’s Scripture of the Peacock Radiant King, Spoken by the August Mother of the Jade Emperor, the Queen of Precious Moonlight**

**Scripture Title:** *The Most High Primordial Heavenly Worthy’s Scripture of the Peacock Radiant King, Spoken by the August Mother of the Jade Emperor, the Queen of Precious Moonlight*
*Compiler unknown; collated and printed by Zhang Guoxiang of the Ming Dynasty. Three fascicles.*

**Source of Base Text:** *Wanli Continuation of the Daoist Canon*

---

**The Most High Primordial Heavenly Worthy’s Scripture of the Peacock Radiant King, Spoken by the August Mother of the Jade Emperor, the Queen of Precious Moonlight, Fascicle One**

The Dao speaks: At that time, the Primordial Heavenly Worthy resided in the Heaven of Great Purity, within the Palace of Pure Tenuity in the Land of Floating Radiance, upon the Jeweled Terrace of Jade Nets, emanating nine-colored auspicious lights. Upon a nine-petaled lotus throne, phoenixes sang and simurghs cried, lions and white cranes encircled, while the Thunder Generals of the Four Directions and all the heavens gathered round.

Formerly, on the fifteenth day of the seventh month in the fourth year of the Dragon Han era, the Earth Officials convened to deliberate the methods of the Southern Numinous Nether Calculations and the texts for delivering and rescuing beings. Before the Dao, the assembly expounded: the Great Emperor Ancestor of the Nine Heavens’ Thunder, the Great Emperor of the Nine Heavens’ Life-Generating Spirits, the Four Brahmā Heavenly Kings, the Five Elders and Six Masters with the Four Sages, the True Lords of the Five Sacred Mountains, the Sage Emperors of the Five Marchmounts, the Source Kings of the Four Watercourses, the True Lords of the Five Celestial Granaries, the Eleven Great Luminaries, the Four Pillars of Destiny, the Four Directions’ Winding Deliverances, the Three Realms and Four Offices, the Heavenly Capital and Earthly Prisons, the Water Realms and Yang Ministries, the Twenty-Eight Constellations, the Three Officials and Great Emperors, the Four Ranks of Fire Officials, the Thirty-Two Heavens, the Thirty-Two Emperors, the Three Origins and Three Hundred Sixty-Five Degrees, the City Gods and Village Altars, the Plague Bureaus of the Judiciary, the Five Lakes and Four Seas of the world, the Nine Rivers and Eight Waters, the Twelve River Sources, the Seventy-Two Blessed Lands, the Three Hundred Sixty Famous Mountains, the Eighteen Prisons of the Earthly Offices, the Twenty-Four Prisons of Fengdu, the Thirty-Six Prisons of Lady Qing, the Central Universal Torment, the Eighty-Four Thousand Layers of Ghostly Dungeons, the Great and Lesser Iron Enclosures, the Mountains of Swords and Lakes of Blood, the Gorges of Stone and Avīci Hell, the Ten Kings of the Nether Offices, the Two Hundred Twenty-Six Heavenly Kings, the Seventy Rakṣasī Women, the Twelve Jade Maidens of Incense Attendance, the Twenty-One Dragon Maidens, the Sixty-Four Māyā Women, the One Hundred Thirty Dragon Kings—each and all arrived to assemble. Bowing their heads in reverence, they paid homage, arrayed themselves in order, and stood in ranks to hear the proclamation of the scripture’s meaning.

Suddenly, a Heavenly Mother arrived, riding a peacock. In the Buddhist teachings, she is the Peacock Tathāgata; in the Dao, she is the August Mother of the Jade Emperor, the Queen of Precious Moonlight. She gathered all the great benevolent deities of the Peacock Scripture to come and attend the Dharma-sound, take refuge in the Great Dao, and once more expound the numinous text of the Peacock’s virtue and power. She wished that within the Dao, she might resolve the calamities and hardships of all beings in the world.

At that time, the Peacock Radiant King circled thrice before the Heavenly Worthy and addressed him, saying: “We, the women of the two gates, today are fortunate to hear and behold your compassionate countenance expounding the scripture and Dharma. We beseech your deliverance and salvation. Whatever the ten entanglements, the karmic debts of three lifetimes, chronic illnesses and prolonged misfortunes, demonic specters and malevolent spirits, rebellious stars and constellations, curses and hexes, or all manner of disasters and misfortunes that afflict men and women in the world—if they but sincerely and reverently invite the good Dao, establish the scripture and Dharma in their homes, and perform the rites, all shall be dissolved. If their qi has not yet departed, they shall be spared from crossing over. Once the grievances of their karmic foes are resolved, they shall recover within three days. With pure body and mind, and fresh garments, they shall open the gates and announce to all the spirit shrines, specially summoning the soul and hastening the fate of so-and-so. They shall petition the Thunder Generals, receiving the talismanic commands of the Jade Purity and the august decrees of the Jade Emperor. Earnestly inviting Orthodox Unity Daoists—or three, five, or seven Daoist adepts—whether at home or in a Daoist abbey, they shall request the recitation of scriptures and repentances, light lamps, and perform the ritual circumambulation. Following the liturgical protocols in devotion, none shall fail to receive response. These are the wondrous words of the Heavenly Sovereign; all above shall act accordingly.”

The Heavenly Worthy proclaimed the commands to the Thunder Lords of the Five Directions, the Thunder Kings of the Five Directions, the Cloud and Thunder Envoys of the Eight Directions, the Marshal Generals of the Thunder Department, and the Investigative Envoys of the Nine Heavens. Each issued orders and decrees, bowed their heads in reverence, took refuge, and pledged to obey.

At that time, the Primordial Heavenly Worthy spoke *The Scripture of the Peacock Radiant King, Spoken by the August Mother of the Jade Emperor, the Queen of Precious Moonlight*.

This scripture, in truth, is the marrow of the Great Cavern Scriptures, the transformative work within the scriptures, the application within the scriptures. For this reason, it was widely transmitted to the world below. Those who receive this Dharma-sound bow their heads to listen to the Dao.

Then, the great assembly again addressed the Heavenly Worthy, saying: “From of old, the Primordial Worthy bestowed it upon the August Mother of Precious Moonlight; the August Mother bestowed it upon the August Earth Queen, the Earthly Thearch; the Earthly Thearch bestowed it upon the Three Officials, Four Sages, and Five Elders of the Lofty Perfected; the Five Elders bestowed it upon the Five Masters; the Heavenly Master in turn bestowed it upon the Perfected of Wondrous Conduct, the Great Compassionate and Great Ultimate Universal Assembly, the Azure Net Savior from Suffering and Universal Savior Perfected One, Lord Xu. It was transmitted down through the generations. At one time, the Perfected of Fixed Radiance propagated the wondrous canon, proclaimed the teachings and Dharma, and universally saved all men and women in the world. Should calamities arise, with sincere heart they may burn incense, present memorials and petitions, recite scriptures and perform repentances, submit sincerity and pledge devotion, offer fresh fruits of the season, invite the Dao and welcome the Perfected. With earnest devotion, they shall recite *The Venerable Scripture of the Peacock Great Radiant King*, and reverently pray. In a basin of water, they shall burn the petition for resolving calamities, dispatching it to the Controller of Destinies, sweeping away demonic influences, and receiving the response of blessings. There is none that shall not be spiritually efficacious. To save a single life in the world is to accumulate ten kinds of merit. Together, they shall amass hidden merit and jointly realize the non-action.”

This is the arcane and wondrous liturgy, the secret transmitted once in ten thousand kalpas. If there are men and women in the world who, with sincere intent, proclaim and recite it to save beings, their fortune and longevity shall be boundless.

Thereupon, the Heavenly Worthy spoke a gāthā, saying:

*All voices chant in succession...*

chunks.original_text: 若有来入法门者，先令平等，毋有杂念。 分班锉锐，然后方行三清净。 第一身清诤，第二口清诤，第三心清净。 又除三业六根，然此可依三洞之法。 永劫无息，常居天堂。 五福常得，百灵守护。 若遇三元五噶，四时八节，本命生辰。 於清净室中，烧香默坐。 束向长脆，稽首叩齿。 谈诵此经，即得长寿。 保命度灾，即说延寿长生中道咒曰： 谈变地花。 玄玄真一身，经演九天文。 飞行泰罗众，金台朝皇人。 无上无苦根，年龄依噬椿。 百体洞琼花，虔谢白元君。 金台童子书，云山保真门。 福德随日新，身光晃三天。 紫盖罗千宫，心皈无上尊。 五福常绵绵，密护玄中人。 驱邪过东海，秉大曜虚皇。 海内无藏处，除非地狱门。 永无鬼业蛆，不闻妙法经。 何能得解悟，元君敕下鬼。 不许恼众生，若不依吾教。 头破作七分，永不闻原赦。 万劫不超生，若是皈依道。 便得上生天，受尽天之福。 五劫轮转成，善男并善女， 同受福千春。 急急如律令。 众□。

Should any seek to enter this Daoist gate, first let them cultivate impartiality, free from stray thoughts. Arrange their ranks and temper their sharpness, then proceed to the Threefold Purity: first, purify the body from contention; second, purify the speech from contention; third, purify the mind. Further, eliminate the three karmic actions and six sensory roots—thus may one follow the laws of the Three Caverns. For aeons without end, they shall dwell in heaven, ever receiving the Five Fortunes, guarded by the hundred spirits.

When encountering the Three Primes, Five Offerings, four seasons, or eight solar terms—on one’s natal day or birth hour—within a purified chamber, burn incense and sit in silent meditation. Face the long-stemmed candle, bow deeply, and click the teeth. Recite this scripture, and longevity shall be attained. To preserve life and transcend calamity, the Middle Way Incantation for Prolonging Life and Longevity is spoken:

*Recite, and the earth transforms into blossoms.*
*The profound True Unity embodies the scripture, unfolding the texts of the Nine Heavens.*
*Soaring through the hosts of Tai Luo, the golden terrace’s courtier approaches the Sovereign.*
*Beyond suffering’s root, years endure like the sacred tree.*
*The hundred limbs radiate as jade flowers; devoutly I thank the White Prime Lord.*
*The Golden Terrace’s youths inscribe the cloud-mountain gate of true preservation.*
*Virtue and fortune renew with each day; the body’s light illumines the Three Heavens.*
*Purple canopies veil a thousand palaces; the heart takes refuge in the Supreme Honored One.*
*The Five Fortunes ever flow; the adept of the Mysterious is secretly shielded.*
*Demons are driven beyond the Eastern Sea, bearing the Great Radiance of the Void Emperor.*
*No refuge remains in the world—save the gates of hell.*
*Eternally free from ghostly karmic grubs, those who hear not the wondrous Dharma scriptures*
*How may they attain liberation? The Prime Lord commands the ghosts:*
*Suffer them not to harass living beings. Should they disobey my teaching,*
*Their heads shall shatter into seven fragments, never to know pardon.*
*For ten thousand kalpas, they shall not transcend rebirth. But those who take refuge in the Dao*
*Shall ascend to heaven, exhausting its blessings.*
*After five kalpas of cyclic transformation, good men and good women*
*Together shall receive a thousand springs of fortune.*
*Hasten, hasten, in accordance with the statutes and decrees.*

All kings and lands, all divine kings of heaven, and the divine healers of illness—all rejoice in boundless, everlasting fortune, attaining peace and bliss. Longevity flourishes, the teachings spread far and wide, and celestial blossoms scatter in profusion.

At that time, the great assembly, having heard this scripture, was filled with immense joy. They bowed in reverence, paid homage, and departed, faithfully receiving and upholding the teachings.

Here ends the first scroll of *The Venerable Scripture of the Radiant Moonlight Empress, Holy Mother of the Peacock Luminous King*, as expounded by the Supreme Primordial Heavenly Origin.

**Dedication, Repentance, and the Three Refuges**

We take refuge in the upper scroll of the scripture, which shields the realm and delivers the virtuous.
May all sentient beings universally take refuge in the Dao-Treasure, the Supreme Venerable.

We take refuge in the middle scroll of the scripture, whose recitation invokes the divine.
May all people in the world universally take refuge in the Scripture-Treasure, the Supreme Venerable.

We take refuge in the lower scroll of the scripture, wherein the phoenix-script holds all numinous texts.
May all who receive and uphold it universally take refuge in the Master-Treasure, the Supreme Venerable.

May all attain long life, each ascending in joy.
May all afflictions be extinguished, forever dispelled and never arise again.
We bow our heads in refuge to the Dao, together weaving this good cause,
To be reborn in the Land of Ultimate Bliss, as those who attend the Dragon-Flower Assembly.

With sincere faith, we bow to the Lord of the Great Dao of the Void Emperor,
Ancestor of the Three Teachings, Father of the Four Births,
He who transforms heaven and humankind,
Supreme Venerable Transmitting Master, who delivers the lost from drought and delusion.
Boundless in transformation, revered by ghosts and spirits,
Tamed are dragons and tigers, myriad virtues pervade the Dharma-realm,
Filling the ten directions.
Supreme is the Way, Primordial Ancestor of the Undifferentiated,
The scriptures may be set aside, yet the Mysterious Origin remains the Supreme Venerable.
We bow our heads to receive the sweet dew.

If one takes refuge in the *Peacock Scripture*,
True Teaching Master, the sins of bodily karma shall be dissolved.
We bow our heads in refuge to the Boundless Great Dao,
The highest good cause.
With sincere hearts, we chant the names of the Dao, the Scriptures, the Masters, and the Heavenly Worthies.

chunks.original_text: 众□ 尔时，天尊为地府拷掠等众，普为人民死亡之后，沉沦地狱。 ．阴司善会，管得超生。 自然无碍，地狱空闲。 灭除罪业，不经地狱。 苦恼辛酸，俱无挂碍。 时有天尊，乃诏勑命，左司阳官，右司阴官，较量功德。 酆都二十四狱拷官典者，放出受苦一切鬼魂，孤爽滞魄，咸登火炼之池。 各执化形，丹界灵符，及护更生。 再得出世，得生人道。 皈依道释二教，钦信三宝，忠孝国君。 更得逍遥自在，与道长存。 於是，天尊普为众生、受苦罪人，尽皆拔度，俱得超升。 汝等众生，各各谛听。 吾当与汝，宣说灭罪升仙咒曰： 酆都夜坚，忽吹光辉。 照出幽魂，乘饴香糜。 灵符火炼，百骸自飞。 得见法会，仙妓知归。 又诵偈曰： 万劫难逢，仙缘可祟。 开癖幽趣， 全假真风。 济惠无穷，念念生因。 驾景飞空，亡魂超度。 九祖生天， 三代离苦。 七祖升迁，弟子人等。 合家康宁，求神得感。 形源复生， 饮食悟味。 消灾免难，增延寿算。 合室光荣，人眷安和。 保佑安宁， 星辰顺度。 福禄增延，五德天福。 四曜增崇，太阴太阳。 胜兴福庆， 二十八宿。 长福消灾，恶曜退位。 福寿光荣，急告玄天。 免离灾迍 存亡两利，祸去福临。 急急如律令。 尔时，元始天尊告太上老君曰：三界众生，漂流苦海，无有解脱。 汝岂受忍，宜须精勤。 奉行秘旨，普皆救度。

They took refuge in the Daoist and Buddhist teachings, revered the Three Treasures, and served their lords with loyalty and filial piety. They gained carefree freedom, abiding with the Dao in perpetuity.

chunks.original_text: 太上劲奉诰命，不敢藏情。 若有众生灾厄疾病，当诵此经。 称念孔雀明王圣母天尊，天王龙王，玉女罗叉，龙女魔耶等众。 并请同念大慈大悲，大惠真人，救苦真人。 即当离苦，长得解脱。 永离萦缠，长生益寿。 寿命延长，一切厄难皆当消灭。 时有太上道君，而说偈曰： 大慈二真人，能救三界苦。 放光照世间，地狱息停住。 刀山高巍巍，擭汤飞炎炎。 志心念真人，罪魂解囚冤。 疾病多苦厄，非灾难可言。 ， 痛脏伤五神，真人愍悲酸。 清信善男女，皈道须志心。 常念众神人，离苦兔忧沉。 疾须清重厄，邪魔不敢侵。 昼夜心不离，解脱全尔身。 勇猛发回向，同归七宝林。 是故我皈依，一心皆恭敬。 於是，尹喜真人启白奏曰：如今下方，众生男子女人，三世冤债，十种大罪，可离解散。 或与维新，增延福寿。 大慈大悲，可免缠害。
chunks.translated_text:
The Most High diligently upholds the decreed mandate, daring not conceal any truth. If there are sentient beings afflicted by calamity, distress, or illness, they should recite this scripture, invoking the sacred names of the Peacock Radiant King, the Holy Mother Heavenly Venerable, the Heavenly Kings, Dragon Kings, Jade Maidens, Rakṣasas, Dragon Maidens, and Māyā and their hosts. Together, they should entreat the Great Compassionate, Great Merciful, Great Benevolent Perfected Ones, and the Perfected Ones Who Save from Suffering. Thereupon, they shall depart from suffering and attain lasting liberation, forever freed from entanglements, gaining longevity and extended life. Their lifespan shall be prolonged, and all calamities and hardships shall be extinguished.

At that time, the Most High Dao Lord spoke in verse:
The Two Perfected Ones of Great Compassion
Can save the suffering of the Three Realms.
They radiate light to illuminate the world,
Causing hells to cease and desist.
Blade mountains stand towering,
Cauldrons of boiling oil blaze fiercely.
With sincere hearts, invoke the Perfected Ones—
Sinful souls shall be freed from imprisonment and grievance.
Illness and manifold suffering,
Calamities beyond description,
Wounding the viscera and the five spirits,
Move the Perfected Ones to pity and sorrow.
Devout faithful men and women,
Returning to the Dao, must set their hearts sincerely.
Ever mindful of the host of divine beings,
They shall depart from suffering and escape sinking sorrow.
Swiftly dispel grave afflictions,
Evil demons dare not encroach.
Day and night, let the heart not stray—
Liberation shall wholly preserve your body.
With courage and resolve, dedicate the merit,
Together returning to the Forest of Seven Treasures.
Thus do I take refuge,
With wholehearted reverence.

Thereupon, the Perfected One Yin Xi respectfully addressed the throne, saying: "Now, in the lower realms, among sentient beings—men and women—whose three lifetimes of karmic debts and ten great sins may be dissolved and dispersed, some may be renewed, their fortune and longevity increased. Through great compassion and great mercy, they may be spared from entanglements and harm."

chunks.original_text: 祸其子孙，累及九祖。 久沉长夜，普望赦宥解脱。 男女轮转人身，不断根本，常居人道。 天尊言：此经是三天圣语，诸真圣言。 如是下界众生，若有男子女人，在於大国中，多行恶事。 不敬天地日月、国王水土、父母生身，呵风骂雨，作诸恶缘。 上古之时，人民淳朴。 心行正直，禀性温和。 不相嫉拓，作诸善念，广行方便。 得其寿长，俱得安然。 今来末世人民，妄言侥幸，人心狡诈。 不修善行，惟集凶恶。 不奉大道，倚托邪神。 作法咒诅、专害人命。 是时真人，再拜上告。 道言：慈念苍生，沉沦下鬼。 魂被拷劫，魂魄无依。 愿解脱之法，使诸众生，免遭枉横。 道言：汝当谛听，吾今所说者。 又见中古之人，专行魇祷。 便於天上地下，邪魔庙社之中，见刑害。 其有姓名庚甲，私窃咒誓，以水喷洒，以脚踏践，努目张口，种种形势。 专无道念，枉害良善。 若自作，若教他作。 若自受，若他返受。
chunks.translated_text:
Their misfortunes shall befall their descendants,
Extending to nine generations of ancestors.
Long sunk in eternal night,
They universally hope for pardon and liberation.
Men and women, cycling through human form,
Never severing the root—ever dwelling in the human realm.

The Heavenly Worthy declared: "This scripture is the sacred utterance of the Three Heavens, the words of all Perfected and Sages. Thus, among the beings of the lower worlds, if there are men or women within great nations who commit many evil deeds—disrespecting Heaven and Earth, the sun and moon, the king, the land and waters, their parents who gave them life; cursing wind and rain, engaging in all manner of wicked causes—
In ancient times, the people were simple and honest,
Their hearts upright, their natures gentle.
They bore no envy or malice,
Cultivated good thoughts,
And widely practiced kindness.
Thus they attained long life,
All dwelling in peace.

Now, in the latter age, people speak falsely of luck,
Their hearts cunning and deceitful.
They cultivate no good conduct,
Only amassing cruelty.
They do not honor the Great Dao,
But rely on perverse spirits.
They perform spells and curses,
Deliberately harming lives."

At that moment, the Perfected One bowed twice and addressed the throne:
The Dao spoke: "With compassion, I think of the living,
Sunken and lost as lower ghosts,

As those who attend the Dragon-Flower Assembly.

With sincere hearts, we bow in reverence
To the Upper Clarity Palace of Yu-Yu.

The Numinous Treasure Venerable expounds the Dharma.

In the great chiliocosm, on Jambudvīpa,

Should one take refuge in the *Peacock Sutra*,

Unfolding the numinous script of the Peacock.

The Five Lakes and Four Seas,
The Nine Rivers and Eight Waters,
The Twelve River Sources,

The Five Bushel Star Lords,
The Twenty-Eight Constellations,
The Eleven Great Luminaries,
The Four Pillars of Destiny,
The true immortals of the ten directions,
And the innumerable hosts—
All came to bow their heads,
Listening to the teachings of the *Peacock Radiant King Sutra*,
To deliver beings from the sufferings of the world.

Riding the Peacock Host,

chunks.original_text: 天下无名得道大龙王。 天下名山福地仙官。 天下洞天诸位仙官。 天下名山隐悟未有名得道仙官。 开念。 启请得道应感二十五位龙王、福地洞天仙官，降赴经筵。 特为某请恩保护，祈佑方来。 皈命孔雀明王经，特与某解灾迍。 皈命孔雀明王尊，愿与某保安宁。 众念奏乐。 稽首皈衣，重伸启请，志心礼谢三清上圣、十极高真。 普天星斗河汉群真。 三官三省四圣上帝。 五老五师诸振师真。 前傅后教历代宗师。 南北束西中五斗星君。 二十八宿十二宫分尊神。 九天曹元列班之众。 值年太岁建生真人。 叨值流年诸宫星斗。 运限禄马一切元辰。 孔雀明王圣母元君。 经中天王龙王一切之众。 经中罗叉魔耶天仙。 经中玉女龙女一切之众。 雷霆一府二院三司天将。 守坛护戒诸位神将。 法录中官将天神官众。 真官土地开化应供天神。 阳问祀典十庙神柢。 家奉三教香火之神。 司命土府禁忌六神。 城隍社令土地之神。 功曹土地里域正神。 三界四府万灵无边真宰。 虚空过往斜察神祇。 经筵会中无鞅之众。 愿消灾障，愿降吉祥。 保佑某安宁，保佑某安宁。 众念。 尔时，妙行真人稽首拜告，而作颂曰： 天真皇人，梵炁玄僚。 天宝自然， 人各知音。 主治世会，变化厄难。 诵求之者，禳除不祥。 清净道炁， 无不安宁。 天官奉书，百灵敬章。 神朱写造，服佩安康。 施之於学， 大吉大祥。 於是，妙行真人稽首，说此咒能消灾厄。 复有太极真人，出班朝礼，而作颂曰： 碧云唤神霄，虚梵豁落语。 层云元始尊，九龙驾皇人。 接青辖灵光，集福真珠景。 开阳孛出书，宝经出圣篇。 福德由是经，移洞玄隐妙。 高严王皇母，宝月光之后。 广发弘誓愿，孔雀大佛母。 能救世间苦，男女尊奉者。 五岳皆降福，四渎迁福寿。 三官俱保举，五斗赦罪愆。 十二宫神吉，二十八宿保平安。 凡在诸行事，志心礼元皇。 稽首皆恭敬，普护降吉祥。 是时，普光真人再告，而作诵曰： 玉帝功德大，玄理极攸深。 生於浩劫前，运化於古今。 圣母说妙经，愍念诸有情。 此经极妙法，功德中功德。 名号最上圣，无此为第一。 大光明王尊，孔雀圣希有。 能破众恶魔，皆令心降伏。 能灭极重罪，皆令得清净。 若人闻是经，或闻是帝名。 稽首生恭敬，一切罪消灭。 十恶四重罪，五逆害父母。 信心志谈演，随声尽消灭。 保护人天众，四相与五衰。 三途极重罪，人间见厄难。 凶年饥馑丧，毒药及厌魅。 刑狱与冤家，军阵斗战苦。 山林恶道中，虎豹豺狼等。 江海毒龙类，迅雷风雨电。 水火及盗贼，蛊毒所中心。 失志发狂乱，蛇竭毒恶虫。 邪魔凶怪神，伺求人便者。 由是此真经，普皆自消灭。 恶病久沉绵，梦寐亦不安。 非理欲残命，珍灭不为殃。 缘遇是经故，安隐得自在。 所有希求愿，财宝及富贵。 以此经功德，如意皆称遂。 神威自在仙，众德十一曜。 三十三天主，二十八宿王。 灵妃玉女等，天神及地祇。 三界虚空神，江海诸龙王。 水火及风神，宫殿与宅舍。 山林树木众，沟渠井泉神。 由是持经故，一切皆拥护。 衣食常自然，子孙居富贵。 出言人希闻，所至皆恭敬。 若为求男女，持诵真灵文。 经勃下天曹，落籍天仙人。 降生於其家，为其作男女。 显贵人崇重，九祖尽升仙。

Primordial *qi* of Brahma’s splendor,
Celestial treasure, naturally so—

Presiding over the world’s assemblies,
Transforming calamities and hardships,
Those who recite and seek its aid
Shall dispel all inauspiciousness.
The pure *qi* of the Dao
Brings peace without exception.
The Heavenly Officials present the scripture,
A hundred spirits revere its chapters.
Inscribed in divine cinnabar,
Worn or carried, it ensures well-being.
Applied in study,
It brings great fortune and great auspiciousness.

Azure clouds summon the Divine Empyrean,

Layered clouds, the Primordial Honored One,
Nine dragons chariot the Sovereign.
They grasp the azure reins of numinous light,
Gathering blessings in true pearl radiance.
The opening sun reveals the scripture,
The sacred canon emerges in holy verses.
Virtue and fortune arise from this sutra,
Its mysteries shift through hidden grottoes.
Exalted and solemn, the Queen Mother of the August Emperor,
The radiant moon’s successor.
Broadly vowing great compassion,
The *Peacock Great Buddha Mother*.
She saves the world’s suffering—
All who honor her, men and women alike.
The Five Marchmounts bestow blessings,
The Four Waterways confer fortune and longevity.
The Three Officials all endorse,
The Five Dippers pardon transgressions.

Sincerely revere the Primordial August One.
With bowed heads and reverence,
Universal protection descends with blessings.

The profound principles of the Mystery reach their depths.
Born before the kalpas,
Operating through past and present.

Compassionately mindful of all sentient beings.
This sutra is the most wondrous Dharma,
The merit among merits.
Its name is the Most Supreme Sage,
Second to none.
The Great Radiant King,
The *Peacock*’s rare sanctity.
It can shatter all evil demons,
Subduing their hearts.
It can eradicate the gravest sins,
Rendering all pure.

Bowing in reverence,
All sins are extinguished.
The ten evils, the four grave offenses,
The five rebellions against father and mother—
With faith, recitation, and discourse,
All vanish at the sound.
It protects humans and heavenly beings,
The four phases and five declines.

Hardships seen in the human realm:

Poisons, curses, and malevolent hexes,
Imprisonment, enemies, and foes,

Perils in mountains and forests,
Tigers, leopards, jackals, and wolves,
Toxic dragons in rivers and seas,
Fierce thunder, wind, rain, and lightning,
Fire, water, and bandits,
The venom of *gu* poisons and their targets,
Madness, delirium, and frenzy,
Snakes, scorpions, and venomous creatures,
Evil demons and malevolent spirits
Seeking opportunities to harm—
All are dissolved by this true sutra.
Chronic and lingering illnesses,
Disturbing dreams and restlessness,
Unjust desires that endanger life,
Premature death—no longer misfortune.
Through encountering this sutra,
One attains peace and freedom.
All aspirations and desires,
Wealth, treasure, and nobility,
Through this sutra’s merit,
Are fulfilled as wished.
Divine immortals of awe-inspiring might,
The hosts of the Eleven Luminaries,
The lords of the Thirty-Three Heavens,
The kings of the Twenty-Eight Constellations,
Divine consorts, jade maidens,
Heavenly deities and earthly spirits,

Illustrious and esteemed,
Nine generations ascend as immortals.

Dragons, cranes, and celestial immortals come to receive it.

On the Ten Offerings.

**Flowers:**
Wondrous blossoms of the immortal realms,
No need for cultivation.
Peonies and peonies with tea roses entwine,
Ten thousand golden lotuses bloom in radiant splendor.
To honor the true forms, flowers are offered.
Flowers are offered,
Offered before the sacred,
The pious patron devoutly presents.
Flowers are offered,
Offered before the Emperor on High.

**Lamps:**
Lamps and candles glow in brilliance,
Illuminating the ten directions.
The devas and constellations radiate their light,
All suffering beings attain liberation.
In homage to the August Sovereign of the Void, lamps are offered.
Lamps are offered,
Offered before the sacred,
The disciple devoutly presents.
Lamps are offered,
Offered before the Emperor on High.

**Scriptures:**
The Peacock’s sacred scripture emerges,
Delivering the floating multitudes from death.
Thirty-six thousand, six sections of wondrous numinous texts,
May all in the world awaken to understanding.
Turning toward the Merciful Honored One, scriptures are offered.
Scriptures are offered,
Offered before the sacred,
The disciple devoutly presents.
Scriptures are offered,
Offered before the Emperor on High.

**Water:**
Dharma water sprinkles boundlessly,
From the numinous spring of the Eastern Well.
Nine dragons spew forth the mysterious primordial,
The yellow blossoms of Stone Landscape are ever purified.
To cleanse the field of the body, water is offered.
Water is offered,
Offered before the sacred,
The disciple devoutly presents.
Water is offered,
Offered before the Emperor on High.

**Tea:**
A hundred sparrows sprout numinous buds,
Within the cup, flowers arise.
The wind is pure, both armpits yearn to ascend in mist,
Able to emulate Lu Tong, who tasted seven bowls.
The wondrous form of the immortal household, tea is offered.
Tea is offered,
Offered before the sacred,
The disciple devoutly presents.
Tea is offered,
Offered before the Emperor on High.

**Wine:**
This wine is unknown in the world,
Its flavor surpasses all brews.
Immortals themselves pluck their zithers to purchase it,
Only wishing to present it before the sacred.
Drunk, one ascends to Penglai, wine is offered.
Wine is offered,
Offered before the sacred,
The disciple devoutly presents.
Wine is offered,
Offered before the Emperor on High.

**Fruit:**
Fire dates and intertwined pears,
Rare immortal fruits.
Pomegranates, red dates, and gosling chestnuts,
The Queen Mother’s thousand-year peaches.
To honor the true forms, fruit is offered.
Fruit is offered,
Offered before the sacred,
The disciple devoutly presents.
Fruit is offered,
Offered before the Emperor on High.

**Vegetarian Offerings:**
The kitchen prepares fragrant vegetarian dishes,
Wondrous in their use.
A hundred delicacies descend from heaven,
Universally presented to the sacred perfected, who deign to receive.
Bestowing blessings and dispelling calamities, vegetarian offerings are made.
Vegetarian offerings are made,
Offered before the sacred,
The disciple devoutly presents.
Vegetarian offerings are made,
Offered before the Emperor on High.

**Clothing:**
Sichuan brocade and Wu silk,
Silks and satins, ever new.
Silver red and purple-green, their hues resplendent,

To honor the Three Clarities, clothing is offered.
Clothing is offered,
Offered before the sacred,
The disciple devoutly presents.
Clothing is offered,
Offered before the Emperor on High.

**Incense:**
A single stick of Dao-virtue incense,

To shelter and safeguard peace, incense is offered.
Incense is offered,
Offered before the sacred,

Incense is offered,

**The Three Refuges and Dedication of Merit**
We take refuge in the most wondrous scriptures,
Protecting the nation and anchoring the celestial stars.
May all beings universally,
Take refuge,
And together rejoice in peace and prosperity.

We take refuge in the wondrous Dharma scriptures,
The Dharma manifests, revealing the celestial deities.
May all spirits in the world universally,
Take refuge,
And together form good karmic causes.

We take refuge in the scriptures of Dao and virtue,
The profound mysteries within the Dao are deep.
May all who recite and intone universally,
Take refuge,
And together ascend to the Jade Capital.

May all attain longevity,
Each one rejoicing in peace and prosperity.
May all afflictions be extinguished,
Dispelled forever, never to arise.
We bow our heads, take refuge in the Dao,
Together forming good karmic causes.
May we be born in the Land of Ultimate Bliss,
As people of the three assemblies beneath the Dragon Flower.

With sincere faith, we pay homage,
To the honored treasure of the Great Clarity’s master.
Through eternal years, in the Palace of the Great Ultimate,
May we observe the world,
All sentient beings.
The Most High Honored One,
All who fall into hell,
Enter deviant sects,
Are reborn as beasts,
Lose their human form—
Relying on the master’s compassion,
To uplift and guide,
The great sage, profoundly efficacious.
Transforming the myriad people,
Cultivating merit and fruit,
Repenting and eradicating the sins of many beings.
The Most High Honored One,
Ten thousand blessings naturally arrive.
If one takes refuge in the Peacock Sutra,
The true teaching’s master,
The sins of the mind and deeds are dissolved.

We bow our heads, take refuge in the Boundless Great Dao.
For the highest good cause,
With sincere devotion, we recite and intone,
Dispelling calamities and obstacles, Heavenly Worthy.
Inconceivable merit and virtue.

Music is played.
Transforming wealth.
Returning the demonstration.
Raising the thought.

We humbly acknowledge that the Dao is transmitted by the sacred,
And cultivation rests with oneself.
All that is done
Arises from the heart.
With earnest and devout prayers,
All pay reverent homage.
From the altar just now,
Having recited and intoned the *Sutra of the Venerable Peacock Radiant King, Holy Mother the Moonlight Empress* several times,
We respectfully dedicate the merit.

To the Three Clarities and August Saints,
The Jade Emperor and Jade Honored One,
The Sacred Father and Sacred Mother,
The Three Treasures and Three Realms,
The sovereign of the Peacock Radiant King,
The lofty perfected of the Dharma realm,
The ancestral masters who transmitted the teachings of past and present,
The celestial beings who expound the scriptures and propagate the Dharma,
The stars of the Southern Asterism and Northern Culmen,
The Dipper constellations of East, West, and Center,
The twenty-eight lunar mansions and twelve palaces,
The myriad perfected of the universal Milky Way,
The Year-Star of the current year and the original spirit of one’s birth,
The stellar deities presiding over the current year,
The sacred emperors of the Five Peaks and Four Waterways,
The dragon deities of the Four Seas and Nine Rivers,
The demonic Yakṣas and dragon maidens,
The dragon lords and jade maidens of the Heavenly Kings,
The local earth deities of ancestral shrines and incense fires,
The dragon deities of life mandates and earthly prohibitions,
The city gods and village altars of local sacrifices,
The temple deities of the sacred Mount Tai in the region,
The fire departments of the plague controllers,
The luminous deities of the earth’s karmic lords,
The heroic spirits responsive to sacrifices,
The malevolent deities of creditors and debtors,
The ghostly multitudes of those with unresolved grievances,
The malevolent spirits causing chaos within the body,
The perfected immortals present in the assembly this day—

Thereupon, the great assembly rejoices,

chunks.original_text: 道场应感之证盟。 纠察护道天神众， 珍妖灭怪众雷兵。 经筵侍闻诸天圣， 一切神仙护教主。 仗此经功，普伸芹奉。 请恩专为某削除罪愆，增崇寿算。 伏愿经力流恩，帝心广布。 好生有感之诚，民心无不之愿。 家邦常享於世域，是非人我以和谐。 凡在有情，均沾圣泽。 稽首皈依，无极大道。 志心称念，孔雀明王大天尊。 众和：不可思议功德。 详夫此经，原所处在武当太岳。 太和紫霄宫李提点，於舍身崖洞裹寻得复人经一部，计八十五卷，后载此道门孔雀经一部三卷。 取出洞门，归宫观之，此乃道释两门之化也。 凡夫不信，吾乃收贮在宫，不觉经中自蕴，不可隐匿，以此可传於世。 今将古本抄录，散施十方。 道士能识音谈演念者，福有千锺。 上报君王，下资三宥。 国泰民安，风调雨顺。 人人乐业，处处和平者。

The witnessing and covenanting deities responsive to the Daoist ritual,
The celestial hosts of inspectors and guardians of the Dao,
The thunder soldiers who subdue demons and vanquish monsters,
The celestial sages attending the scriptural assembly,
All divine immortals and protectors of the teachings—
By the merit of this scripture, we humbly offer our devotion.
We beseech your grace, specifically for [Name], to eradicate transgressions and augment longevity.

May the power of this scripture extend its blessings, and the imperial heart dispense boundless grace.
May the sincerity of cherishing life move all, and the people’s hearts harbor no unfulfilled wishes.
May the realm and its households perpetually enjoy peace,
And all disputes and self-interest yield to harmony.
May all sentient beings equally partake in the sacred grace.

We bow our heads in reverence, taking refuge in the Boundless Dao.
With devoted hearts, we invoke the Great Heavenly Worthy of the Peacock Radiance.
All respond: Inconceivable merit and virtue.

This scripture, in its origin, was discovered within the Wudang Great Peak.
Li, the superintendent of the Purple Cloud Palace of Supreme Harmony, found a lost scripture of eighty-five scrolls within a cave behind the Cliff of Self-Abandonment. Appended to it was this Daoist Peacock Scripture in three scrolls.
Retrieved from the cave’s depths and returned to the palace, it was revealed to be a convergence of Daoist and Buddhist teachings.
Though some may doubt, I have preserved it within the palace. Unbeknownst, the scripture’s inherent power could not be concealed, and thus it is fitting to transmit it to the world.
Now, copying the ancient text, we distribute it to all directions.
Should Daoist priests recognize its sounds, chant, and recite it, their blessings shall be immeasurable.
Above, it repays the sovereign; below, it aids the three realms.
The nation prospers, the people are at peace, winds are harmonious, and rains are timely.
All people delight in their livelihoods, and everywhere reigns tranquility.
